Anderson performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn.

Claire Antoinette Laverge, the daughter of Regine A. Laverge-Schade of Washington Depot, Conn., and Hendrik J. Laverge of New York, was married yesterday to Peter Andrew Petitt, the son of Ann Petitt Webber of New Canaan, Conn., and the late Phil A. Petitt. The Rev. Cheryl P. Anderson performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn.

Mrs. Petitt, 28, is a producer for community topics at BayInsider.com, a local information Web site in San Francisco. She graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree in public international law from Leiden University in the Netherlands.

Her father is the managing partner of Frick, Wellington & Laverge, a company in New York that helps businesses establish and manage new ventures. Her mother imports, sells and consults on garden furnishings in Washington Depot and is a member of the executive board of the Netherlands-America Foundation, a cultural exchange society in New York.

Mr. Petitt, 29, is a senior associate at Robertson Stephens, a San Francisco investment bank, where he works on initial public offerings, mergers and acquisitions of companies in the technology sector and does other strategic consulting. He graduated from Colorado College and received an M.B.A. from Dartmouth College.

His mother retired as an owner of Flowers & Company, a floral arranger, and as a residential sales agent for Scott Associates, a real estate agency, both in Darien. His father was a senior vice president at E. F. Hutton & Company in New York, where he was an investment banker.
